At Governor Pritzker's press conference announcing that Illinois will enter Phase 4 on Friday, June 26, Dr. Ezike encouraged Illinois residents to make appointments to visit their doctors now. We would like to remind parents/guardians that Illinois School Code requires all students entering preschool, kindergarten and 6th grade to receive physical exams and the required immunizations before the school year begins. This is also true for all students who are new to ASD4. Children who do not have their immunizations and physicals on file prior to the first day of school will be excluded from school until these records are up to date.
In addition, an athletic permit card is required of all students participating in Indian Trail Junior High School athletic programs. http://edl.io/n1250055

Did you know that it is a violation of Illinois state law to drive past a school bus that is stopped and picking up or dropping off children? When the stop arm is out and the red lights are flashing, drivers need to stop until the arm is pulled back. Violations can come with penalties up to $500 in fines and suspension of driverâ€™s license up to a year.

The exception to this law is that drivers who are travelling in the opposite direction of a bus on a road that is 4 or more lanes (Lake St., Army Trail Blvd., Addison Rd., Rohlwing Rd.) do not need to stop.

Drivers are also advised not to make U-turns to avoid waiting for a stopped school bus.

The law is designed to keep students safe. Drivers should plan ahead and allow extra time if they will be on the roads at the beginning or end of the school day.

As more wintry weather approaches, any unplanned school closings ("Snow Days!") will be posted on :
-the ASD4 website, //www.asd4.org
-this Facebook page, Addison District 4
-Twitter, @AddisonSD4
-Emergency Closing Center, www.emergencyclosings.com (you can sign up for personalized e-mail notification of your school's status at www.emergencyclosing.com)
-Radio stations, WGN-720am, WBBM-780am
-TV stations, CBS, NBC, ACTV, ABC, WGN, FOX, CLTV

Automated phone calls are also made to the contact numbers that are on file for each student. If your number has recently changed, please contact the school office with your new telephone number.
